--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Cesar G. Miguel" <ce=
sar.gomes@...> wrote:
>
> Peter B. and I have been doing some experiments w=
ith Breve using the
> NEAT-Python implementation. It's not a plugin, though=
. You have to set
> up a fitness function that calls the Breve engine from =
the command
> line and passes the chromosomes by argument. Once the Breve s=
imulation
> is finished, it returns the fitness for each individual.
> 
> S=
o it's a two-step problem: first set-up your environment within
> Breve, as=
 you'd do in a normal experiment; then you define a fitness
> function to l=
oad that environment every time you need to evaluate the
> population. Thin=
k of Breve as the "evaluator" and not part of NEAT.
> It's a completely sep=
arated module.
> 
> If you have interest, we can send you the code. It only=
 works in linux
> right now, given that you need to use some shell scripts.=
 But I think
> it won't be hard to translate that into a bat file.
> 
> Ces=
ar
>
